results.title: Liz Cheney Is Prepared to Lose Power, and It Shows
results.abstract: The meaning, and cost, of going against Donald Trump.

results.adx_keywords: Pop and Rock Music;Disabilities;Cerebral Palsy;Knowles, Beyonce
results.title: Beyoncé Will Change Lyrics After Criticism Over ‘Ableist Language’
results.abstract: The pop star’s decision to replace two words in her song “Heated” follows Lizzo’s removal of the same term, which has been used as a slur against disabled people, from her track “Grrrls.”

media.caption: “The word, not used intentionally in a harmful way, will be replaced,” a spokeswoman for Beyoncé said in an email.

results.adx_keywords: Witchcraft;False Arrests, Convictions and Imprisonments;History (Academic Subject);Education (K-12);Johnson, Elizabeth Jr (1670-1716);Andover (Mass);North Andover (Mass);Salem (Mass);Massachusetts
results.title: Last Conviction in Salem Witch Trials Is Cleared 329 Years Later
results.abstract: The exoneration of Elizabeth Johnson Jr., the last person whose name was not officially cleared, came from the efforts of an eighth-grade civics teacher and her students.

media.caption: A tour group at the Salem Witch Trials Memorial in Salem, Mass.

results.byline: By Bill Pennington and Doug Mills
results.title: LIV Golfers, Paid Upfront, Giggle Their Way Around Trump Bedminster
results.abstract: Henrik Stenson won the third event on the LIV Golf tour, where nine-figure signing bonuses for top players guaranteed a carefree vibe.

media.caption: Brooks Koepka and his wife, Jena Sims, rode a golf cart just before the start of the LIV Golf event in Bedminster, N.J.

results.title: A Town’s Housing Crisis Exposes a ‘House of Cards’
results.abstract: In the Idaho resort area of Sun Valley, there are so few housing options that many workers are resorting to garages, campers and tents.

media.copyright: Natalie Behring for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Wildfires;Fires and Firefighters;Global Warming;California;Siskiyou County (Calif)
results.title: McKinney Fire Becomes California’s Largest of 2022
results.abstract: Storm winds, high temperatures and drought conditions helped the fire grow over the weekend, officials said. Two people were found dead in a vehicle on Sunday.

results.title: A Nigerian Street Vendor Is Beaten to Death in Italy as Witnesses Stand By
results.abstract: The killing, in a seaside town on the Adriatic, has shocked Italians because of its brutality and because of the indifference of those looking on.

results.title: U.S. Warns China Not to Turn Pelosi’s Expected Trip to Taiwan Into a ‘Crisis’
results.abstract: Speaker Nancy Pelosi, a longtime China hawk, has not confirmed that she plans to visit Taiwan, but all indications suggest that she will make a stop on the self-governing island without prior announcement.

results.byline: By Farnaz Fassihi and Michael Levenson
results.title: ‘One miscalculation away from nuclear annihilation’: The U.N. chief issues a grim warning, citing war.
results.abstract: The conflict in Ukraine and tensions over North Korea and Iran have lifted the threat of nuclear disaster to a level not seen since the Cold War.

results.adx_keywords: Bicycles and Bicycling;Electric Bicycles, Motorcycles and Scooters;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Steinsapir, Kaye;Steinsapir, Molly;Steinsapir, Jonathan;Rad Power Bikes LLC
results.title: ‘Team Molly’ Parents Sue E-Bike Company Over Daughter’s Death
results.abstract: An online community offered support for Molly Steinsapir, a 12-year-old who experienced brain trauma in an accident last year. Her mother and father have filed suit against Rad Power Bikes.

media.caption: Jonathan and Kaye Steinsapir in the room of their daughter, Molly, who died last year after an e-bike accident.
media.copyright: Adam Perez for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Parenting;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Demonstrations, Protests and Riots;Midterm Elections (2022);Coronavirus Reopenings;Rumors and Misinformation;Social Media;Vaccination and Immunization;Masks;Children and Childhood;Project Democracy;United States Politics and Government;Facebook Inc;United States
results.title: How Some Parents Changed Their Politics in the Pandemic
results.abstract: They were once Democrats and Republicans. But fears for their children in the pandemic transformed their thinking, turning them into single-issue voters for November’s midterms.

media.caption: A rally against vaccine and mask mandates in Washington, D.C., in January. Many parents joined the anti-vaccine movement during the pandemic.
media.copyright: Kenny Holston for The New York Times

results.title: Pat Carroll, TV Mainstay Turned Stage Star, Dies at 95
results.abstract: Tired of sitcoms and game shows, she reinvented herself in a one-woman show about Gertrude Stein — and, later, in a gender-bending Shakespeare role.

media.caption: Pat Carroll backstage in 1990 at the Folger Shakespeare Theater in Washington, where she played Falstaff in “The Merry Wives of Windsor.”

results.title: How Monkeypox Went From Containable to Crisis

results.title: A 17-Year-Old Is Killed and 4 Are Hospitalized in River Tubing Stabbing
results.abstract: The suspect, a 52-year-old man from Minnesota, had left the scene but was taken into custody after a witness identified him, the authorities said. A motive was not immediately clear.

media.caption: The authorities searched the area near the Apple River with metal detectors after five people were stabbed while tubing down the river on Saturday.
media.copyright: Alex Kormann/Star Tribune, via Associated Press

results.title: Trump-Backed Conspiracy Theorist Vies to Take Over Arizona Elections
results.abstract: Mark Finchem, a full-throated MAGA warrior, is a leading contender to be Arizona’s next secretary of state. He has said he won’t concede if he loses.

media.caption: Mark Finchem at a candidate luncheon in Sun City West, Ariz. His policies would upend the voting process in the state.
media.copyright: Adriana Zehbrauskas for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Actors and Actresses;Black People;Television;Deaths (Obituaries);Space and Astronomy;Nichols, Nichelle
results.title: Nichelle Nichols, Lieutenant Uhura on ‘Star Trek,’ Dies at 89
results.abstract: She was among the first Black women to have a leading role in a TV series. She later worked with NASA to recruit minorities for the space program.

media.caption: Nichelle Nichols on “Star Trek” in 1967. She played Lieutenant Uhura, an officer and a highly educated technician who maintained a businesslike demeanor in performing her duties.

results.title: ‘They’re Just Going to Let Me Die?’ One Woman’s Abortion Odyssey
results.abstract: Madison Underwood was thrilled to learn she was pregnant. But when a rare defect in the developing fetus threatened her life, she was thrust into post-Roe chaos.

media.caption: Madison Underwood hugging her mother while her fiancé, Adam Queen, takes a break from the predawn drive across state lines to a Georgia abortion clinic.
media.copyright: Kendrick Brinson for The New York Times
